Open time of this location, in 4-digit 24-hour time format (HHmm) of this location's timezone. Refraining from including minutes is a recommended best practice.

For example: 0900 to represent 9:00am in local time

closeTime.description:
Close time of this location, in 4-digit 24-hour time format (HHmm) of this location's timezone. Refraining from including minutes is a recommended best practice.

For example: 2200 to represent 10:00pm in local time

Contacts phone number at this location in .e164 format

For example: +17148130000

email.description: Contact email to receive consignee scheduling notifications.

phoneNumber.description:
Contact phone number in .e164 format.

For example: +17148130000

appointmentContact.description: Only for use with the scheduleDelivery accessorial. Alternate contact information if the consignee is not scheduling delivery.

delivery.description: Object containing delivery (consignee) location information. Must contain either placeId or address.

rateResponseTimeoutMs.description:
Timeout (in milliseconds) for rates to be returned. Default is 25000ms. Some carriers take longer than others to return rates, so a lower rateResponseTimeoutMs may result in fewer rates being returned. Certain platforms, like Shopify, have a strict timeout time, so a lower rateResponseTimeoutMs may be necessary for your use-case. Use with caution.
 - If you are unsure, leave this field blank.
 - If you are experiencing issues with rates not being returned, you may want to increase this value.
 - This value is the time taken to retrieve the rate. If you have a hard limit on the time to wait for a response, you should set a timeout on the request itself.
NOTE - If set, the minimum value is 5000ms (5 seconds)

quantity.description: Quantity of this cargo line item

type.description:
Type of this cargo. Can be: Bag, Bale, Box, Bucket, Bundle, Can, Carton, Case, Coil, Crate, Cylinder, Drum, Pail, Pallet, Pieces, Reel, Roll, Skid, Tote, or Tube.

LooseItem has been deprecated in favor of Pieces.

weight.description:
Weight (in pounds) of each item in this line item

For example, if you have a 1600 lb shipment consisting of 4 pallets at 400 lbs each, this property should be 400 lbs

length.description: Length (in inches) of each item in this line item

width.description: Width (in inches) of each item in this line item

height.description: Height (in inches) of each item in this line item

description.description: Cargo description of this line item

freight.description: Array of freight information. Each array element represents a different line item of freight

pickupReadyDate.description:
Date and time of day that this shipment will be ready to be picked up. Object consisting of `date` and `time` where `date` has a format of "YYYY-MM-DD"and `time` has a 24-hour time format, such as "0900".
For example: {"date": "2024-01-30", "time": "0900"}

applyAvailableCredits.description: If false, will not apply any available credits on the shipper account to this quote

declaredFreightValue.description: Declared freight value in Dollars. This enables insurance coverage in USD Currency

CreateQuoteRequestSchema.description: Declared freight value in Dollars. This enables insurance coverage in USD Currency

id.description: Quote ID, which can be used in the Create Shipment Endpoint

expiresAt.description: ISOString representing when this quote expires and can no longer be used in the Create Shipment endpoint

price.description: Price, in USD, of the rate

estimatedPickupDate.description: ISOString representing the estimated earliest datetime that this shipment would be picked up at

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: ISOString representing the estimated latest datetime that this shipment would be delivered at

provider.description: The shipping provider for this rate

providerScac.description: The shipping provider for this rate

truck.description: Truck is deprecated. This is the truck equipment and specialty for this rate. This is often unknown as purchase time so should be ignored.

services.description: List of services associated with this rate

serviceType.description: Service type is deprecated in favor of the services. Please use that instead. This will often be returned as "other"

warnings.description: List of warnings associated with this rate

creditsApplied.description: Dollars of credit applied towards this rate

coveragePrice.description: Price of the insurance coverage in USD

coveredValue.description: Freight's value covered by insurance in USD

rates.description: Array of available rates that can be purchased. Desired rate should be passed into the Create Shipment endpoint with the Quote ID

quantity.description: Quantity of this cargo line item

type.description:
Type of this cargo. Can be: Bag, Bale, Box, Bucket, Bundle, Can, Carton, Case, Coil, Crate, Cylinder, Drum, Pail, Pallet, Pieces, Reel, Roll, Skid, Tote, or Tube.

LooseItem has been deprecated in favor of Pieces.

Weight (in pounds) of each item in this line item

For example, if you have a 1600 lb shipment consisting of 4 pallets at 400 lbs each, this property should be 400 lbs

width.description: Width (in inches) of each item in this line item

city.description: City in which the shipment is currently residing in

state.description: State in which the shipment is currently residing in

deliveryLocationName.description: Name of the location the shipment is being delivery to

pickupLocationName.description: Name of the location the shipment is being picked up from

shipmentReferenceNumber.description: Reference number that identifies the shipment

proNumber.description: Pro number for the shipment, if one is available from the provider

timestamp.description: ISO string of when the tracking event took place

status.description: New status of the shipment, or a description of how the shipment is progressing from an integrated carrier

url.description: Redirect to presigned url for file id

id.description: The ID of the payment term

createdAt.description: ISO string of when the payment term was first created

updatedAt.description: ISO string of when the payment term was last updated

name.description: The name of your company account

email.description: The primary email of your company account

phoneNumber.description: The primary phone number of your company account

paymentTermsEnabled.description: Are payment terms enabled for the account

paymentTermLengthDays.description: The number of days from invoice to payment due

creditLimitAmount.description: The total amount of term credit in USD

availableCreditAmount.description: The amount in USD due remaining on the credit term

totalAmountDue.description: The total amount due in USD of unpaid invoices

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase

lastModifiedAt.description: The most recent timestamp the invoice was modified at.

hasMore.description: True if there are more records to fetch.

total.description: The total number of invoices that are modified on or after the date.

limit.description: The number of results requested in this page, not necessarily the number of results returned if on the last page.

currentPage.description: The index of the current page of results returned.

nextPage.description: The index of the next page of results to fetch, if available.

createdAt.description: ISO string of when the invoice was first created

updatedAt.description: ISO string of when the invoice was last updated

dueDate.description: ISO string of when the invoice is required to be paid by

total.description: The total amount (in cents) of the invoice in USD

amountDue.description: The amount (in cents) in USD due remaining on the invoice

credits.description: The credits applied to the invoice

payments.description: The payments applied to the invoice

paidAmount.description: The amount (in cents) paid against this invoice

creditedAmount.description: The amount (in cents) credit back to this invoice

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Defaulted to 'usd'.

referenceNumber.description: The reference number of the invoice. This is not guaranteed to be unique nor match the reference number of it's owning entity type

entityType.description: The invoiceable entity type, most commonly 'shipment'

entityId.description: The invoiceable entity id, most commonly the shipment id

BadRequest.description: Server cannot process request due to invalid request.

Forbidden.description: Requesting user does not have permission to use this resource.

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to retrieve details about their company account

200.description: Account details response is wrapped inside an object named "data"

id.description: The ID of the payment term

createdAt.description: ISO string of when the payment term was first created

updatedAt.description: ISO string of when the payment term was last updated

name.description: The name of your company account

email.description: The primary email of your company account

phoneNumber.description: The primary phone number of your company account

paymentTermsEnabled.description: Are payment terms enabled for the account

paymentTermLengthDays.description: The number of days from invoice to payment due

creditLimitAmount.description: The total amount of term credit in USD

availableCreditAmount.description: The amount in USD due remaining on the credit term

totalAmountDue.description: The total amount due in USD of unpaid invoices

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to generate URLs directing to shipment documents like the Bill of Lading and Proof of Delivery, if available.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: Shipment ID of the shipment to generate document URLs for

200.description: Document details responses are wrapped inside an array named "data"

expiresAt.description: ISOString representing the datetime of when the document URL will expire

get.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a download url for a file by file Id

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: File ID to generate a download url

301.description: Redirects to the download url for the requested file

url.description: Redirect to presigned url for file id

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to pass in an ISO timestamp and receive a list of references to invoices that have either been created or modified on or after that date.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: The ISO timestamp of the on or after date to query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination across multiple pages of results. Dont include this parameter on the first call. Use the nextPage value returned in a previous response to request subsequent results.

200.description: Response is wrapped inside an object named "data"

lastModifiedAt.description: The most recent timestamp the invoice was modified at.

hasMore.description: True if there are more records to fetch.

total.description: The total number of invoices that are modified on or after the date.

limit.description: The number of results requested in this page, not necessarily the number of results returned if on the last page.

currentPage.description: The index of the current page of results returned.

nextPage.description: The index of the next page of results to fetch, if available.

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to retrieve an invoice

parameters.name: invoiceId
parameters.description: ID of the invoice to get fetch

200.description: Invoice details response is wrapped inside an object named "data"

createdAt.description: ISO string of when the invoice was first created

updatedAt.description: ISO string of when the invoice was last updated

dueDate.description: ISO string of when the invoice is required to be paid by

total.description: The total amount (in cents) of the invoice in USD

amountDue.description: The amount (in cents) in USD due remaining on the invoice

credits.description: The credits applied to the invoice

payments.description: The payments applied to the invoice

paidAmount.description: The amount (in cents) paid against this invoice

creditedAmount.description: The amount (in cents) credit back to this invoice

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Defaulted to 'usd'.

referenceNumber.description: The reference number of the invoice. This is not guaranteed to be unique nor match the reference number of it's owning entity type

entityType.description: The invoiceable entity type, most commonly 'shipment'

entityId.description: The invoiceable entity id, most commonly the shipment id

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to retrieve an array of place IDs that represent addresses that may be used as the pickup location or delivery for a quote.

200.description: Place details responses are wrapped inside an array named "data"

state.description: 2-letter state abbrevation of the address

zip.description: Postal zip code of the address

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to fetch address details for the given place ID.

200.description: Place details response is wrapped inside an object named "data"

state.description: 2-letter state abbrevation of the address

zip.description: Postal zip code of the address

code-samples.name: default
code-samples.code:
curl --request POST \
--url https://sandbox.api.mothership.com/beta/quotes \
--header 'accept: application/json' \
--header 'authorization: Bearer {YOUR_TOKEN_HERE}' \
--header 'content-type: application/json' \
--data '{
   "freight": [{
     "quantity": 2,
     "type": "Pallet",
     "weight": 50,
     "length": 48,
     "width": 42,
     "height": 46,
     "description": "T-shirts"
   }],
   "pickup": {
     "name": "Griffith Observatory",
     "address": {
       "street": "2800 E Observatory Rd",
       "city": "Los Angeles",
       "state": "CA",
       "zip": "90027"
     },
     "accessorials": ["liftgate"],
     "phoneNumber": "+15555555555",
     "emails": ["logistics@mothership.com"],
     "openTime": "1000",
     "closeTime": "2200"
   },
   "delivery": {
     "name": "LACMA",
      "address": {
        "street": "5905 Wilshire Blvd",
        "city": "Los Angeles",
        "state": "CA",
        "zip": "90036"
     },
     "accessorials": ["liftgate", "residential"],
     "phoneNumber": "+15555555555",
     "emails": ["logistics@mothership.com"],
     "openTime": "1100",
     "closeTime": "1700"
   },
   "pickupReadyDate": {
     "date": "2024-10-15",
     "time": "1000"
   }
 }'

post.description: This endpoint allows a user to pass in shipment details and create a quote. This response will return the available rates with respective prices, and also return a quote ID that can be used in the Create Shipment endpoint.

subStreet.description: Substreet of the address, such as suite number or letter. Deprecated - please provide this in the address field.

accessorials.description: Array of accessorials required at this location

emails.description: Array of emails to receive notification emails

openTime.description:
Open time of this location, in 4-digit 24-hour time format (HHmm) of this location's timezone. Refraining from including minutes is a recommended best practice.

For example: 0900 to represent 9:00am in local time

closeTime.description:
Close time of this location, in 4-digit 24-hour time format (HHmm) of this location's timezone. Refraining from including minutes is a recommended best practice.

For example: 2200 to represent 10:00pm in local time

referenceNumber.description: Reference number set for this location

phoneNumber.description:
Contacts phone number at this location in .e164 format

For example: +17148130000

placeId.description: Deprecated -- please use address parameter instead. Place ID acquired from the Fetch Places endpoint.

subStreet.description: Substreet of the address, such as suite number or letter.

state.description: 2-letter state abbreviation name of the address

zip.description: Postal zip code of the address

pickup.description: Object containing pickup (shipper) location information. Must contain either placeId or address.

state.description: 2-letter state abbreviation name of the address

zip.description: Postal zip code of the address

email.description: Contact email to receive consignee scheduling notifications.

phoneNumber.description:
Contact phone number in .e164 format.

For example: +17148130000

appointmentContact.description: Only for use with the scheduleDelivery accessorial. Alternate contact information if the consignee is not scheduling delivery.

delivery.description: Object containing delivery (consignee) location information. Must contain either placeId or address.

rateResponseTimeoutMs.description:
Timeout (in milliseconds) for rates to be returned. Default is 25000ms. Some carriers take longer than others to return rates, so a lower rateResponseTimeoutMs may result in fewer rates being returned. Certain platforms, like Shopify, have a strict timeout time, so a lower rateResponseTimeoutMs may be necessary for your use-case. Use with caution.
 - If you are unsure, leave this field blank.
 - If you are experiencing issues with rates not being returned, you may want to increase this value.
 - This value is the time taken to retrieve the rate. If you have a hard limit on the time to wait for a response, you should set a timeout on the request itself.
NOTE - If set, the minimum value is 5000ms (5 seconds)

quantity.description: Quantity of this cargo line item

type.description:
Type of this cargo. Can be: Bag, Bale, Box, Bucket, Bundle, Can, Carton, Case, Coil, Crate, Cylinder, Drum, Pail, Pallet, Pieces, Reel, Roll, Skid, Tote, or Tube.

LooseItem has been deprecated in favor of Pieces.

weight.description:
Weight (in pounds) of each item in this line item

For example, if you have a 1600 lb shipment consisting of 4 pallets at 400 lbs each, this property should be 400 lbs

length.description: Length (in inches) of each item in this line item

width.description: Width (in inches) of each item in this line item

height.description: Height (in inches) of each item in this line item

description.description: Cargo description of this line item

freight.description: Array of freight information. Each array element represents a different line item of freight

pickupReadyDate.description:
Date and time of day that this shipment will be ready to be picked up. Object consisting of `date` and `time` where `date` has a format of "YYYY-MM-DD"and `time` has a 24-hour time format, such as "0900".
For example: {"date": "2024-01-30", "time": "0900"}

applyAvailableCredits.description: If false, will not apply any available credits on the shipper account to this quote

declaredFreightValue.description: Declared freight value in Dollars. This enables insurance coverage in USD Currency

schema.description: Declared freight value in Dollars. This enables insurance coverage in USD Currency

201.description: Created quote response is wrapped inside an object named "data"

id.description: Quote ID, which can be used in the Create Shipment Endpoint

expiresAt.description: ISOString representing when this quote expires and can no longer be used in the Create Shipment endpoint

price.description: Price, in USD, of the rate

estimatedPickupDate.description: ISOString representing the estimated earliest datetime that this shipment would be picked up at

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: ISOString representing the estimated latest datetime that this shipment would be delivered at

provider.description: The shipping provider for this rate

providerScac.description: The shipping provider for this rate

truck.description: Truck is deprecated. This is the truck equipment and specialty for this rate. This is often unknown as purchase time so should be ignored.

services.description: List of services associated with this rate

serviceType.description: Service type is deprecated in favor of the services. Please use that instead. This will often be returned as "other"

warnings.description: List of warnings associated with this rate

creditsApplied.description: Dollars of credit applied towards this rate

coveragePrice.description: Price of the insurance coverage in USD

coveredValue.description: Freight's value covered by insurance in USD

rates.description: Array of available rates that can be purchased. Desired rate should be passed into the Create Shipment endpoint with the Quote ID

latitude.description: The latitude of the shipment's last estimated location.

longitude.description: The longitude of the shipment's last estimated location.

pickupNumber.description: The pickup number associated with the partner shipment.

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to get a list of tracking events related to a shipment

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: Shipment ID of the shipment to get tracking

200.description: Tracking responses are wrapped inside an array named "results"

city.description: City in which the shipment is currently residing in

state.description: State in which the shipment is currently residing in

deliveryLocationName.description: Name of the location the shipment is being delivery to

pickupLocationName.description: Name of the location the shipment is being picked up from

shipmentReferenceNumber.description: Reference number that identifies the shipment

proNumber.description: Pro number for the shipment, if one is available from the provider

timestamp.description: ISO string of when the tracking event took place

status.description: New status of the shipment, or a description of how the shipment is progressing from an integrated carrier

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to fetch all webhook configs set up for his/her shipper account.

200.description: Webhook config responses are wrapped inside an array named "data"

createdAt.description: ISOString representing the datetime that this webhook config was created

status.description: Current status of the webhook config

subscribedEvents.description: Array of events that will trigger a webhook event

webhookUrl.description: URL that Mothership's server will POST webhook events to

post.description: This endpoint allows a user to create a webhook config for his/her shipper account.

requestBody.description: Data used to create a Webhook Config

webhookUrl.description: URL that Mothership's server will POST webhook events to

subscribedEvents.description: Array of events that will trigger a webhook event

createdAt.description: ISOString representing the datetime that this webhook config was created

status.description: Current status of the webhook config

subscribedEvents.description: Array of events that will trigger a webhook event

webhookUrl.description: URL that Mothership's server will POST webhook events to

secretKey.description: Secret key specific to this token record that can be used to validate incoming webhook payloads

get.description: This endpoint allows a user to fetch the webhook config represented by webhookConfigId.

parameters.name: webhookConfigId
parameters.description: ID of the webhook config to fetch

status.description: Current status of the webhook config

webhookUrl.description: URL that Mothership's server will POST webhook events to

put.description: This endpoint allows a user to update the webhook config represented by webhookConfigId.

status.description: Current status of the webhook config
